meanings.definition: The act of making something solemn or serious.
meanings.sent1: The solemnizations of the ceremony brought tears to everyone's eyes.
meanings.sent2: The wedding solemnizations were beautifully conducted by the officiant.
meanings.sent3: The solemnizations of the birthday party made the clown's jokes seem out of place.
meanings.sent4: The solemnizations of the treaty signing echoed through the halls of history.
meanings.sent5: The solemnizations of the funeral procession left a lasting impact on the community.

meanings.definition: The formal or ceremonial observance of an event or occasion.
meanings.sent1: The solemnizations of the graduation were filled with pride and joy.
meanings.sent2: The religious solemnizations at the temple were attended by many believers.
meanings.sent3: The solemnizations of the annual festival included a parade of colorful floats.
meanings.sent4: The solemnizations of the national anthem before the game united the crowd in patriotism.
meanings.sent5: The solemnizations of the award ceremony honored the achievements of the students.
